title: Ticket #7693: Support oauth tokens and krb/kerberos credentials in local universe
description:
Currently, LOCAL and SCHEDULER universe jobs do not have the ability to run with a user's OAuth tokens or Kerberos credentials.

Adding this support for LOCAL universe would involve having the Starter process know to do the work that the shadow does when OAuth credentials ar erequested (as opposed to using a shadow syscall, since there is no shadow in this case). This is essentially reading files while root and then writing them into the sandbox while impersonating the user. Once that is in place, it should be fairly straightforward since there IS a job sandbox for the job so the credentials can be placed there and managed normally by the Starter.

For SCHEDULER universe this would be much more work because there is no Starter process to manage credentials and no job sandbox in which to place them.
